text: I'm Thomas Kaplan of the New York Times
the Justice Department is prepared to
auction off thousands of items owned by
Bernard Madoff and his wife items that
were seized as part of his criminal
prosecution these are some of the prized
possessions of the convicted fraudster
the goal is to raise money to repay the
victims of Madoff vast Ponzi scheme as
with an earlier auction plenty of
watches and jewels are up for grabs but
so are many less glamorous trinkets with
mr. Madoff in jail and his wife Ruth in
seclusion the Madoff furniture utensils
and bath towels among other things are
in need of new homes nearly 500 Lots
encompassing several thousand items
overall will be available for sale at
the auction I think that there's a
little bit of 15 minutes of fame for
anything that you buy here plus there's
a collector value and as you're well
aware Bernie's not going away you know
he's in the news media every single day
and if you could say I bought something
that was in Bernie's house then I think
there is a collector value to it a
previous auction raised about $1,000,000
for the victims of Madoff's Ponzi scheme
one more auction featuring items from
Madoff Palm Beach home will be held in
Florida next spring
Madoff like to buy in bulk had a
propensity for avoiding wrinkles and
monogram many of his belongings these
slippers bearing Madoff's initials in
gold thread will likely be a top
attraction at the auction the auction is
open to the public it will be held on
Saturday at a hotel in midtown Manhattan
and simulcast on the web
this is Thomas Kaplan for deal book
